title: Mujahideen
summary: Mujahideen, or Mujahidin (Arabic: مُجَاهِدِين‎, romanized: mujāhidīn), is the plural form of mujahid (Arabic: مجاهد‎, romanized: mujāhid, lit. 'strugglers or strivers [for justice, right conduct, Godly rule, etc.], doers of jihād'), an Arabic term that broadly refers to Islamic guerrillas who engage in jihad (lit. 'struggle or striving [for justice, right conduct, Godly rule, etc.]'), interpreted in a jurisprudence of Islam as the fight on behalf of God, religion or the community (ummah).[1][2][3]
